93-year-old Caucasian male.context: The patient is a 93-year-old Caucasian male who was admitted to ABCD General Hospital on 08/07/2003 secondary to ischemic ulcer on the right foot.

ischemic ulcer.context: The patient is a 93-year-old Caucasian male who was admitted to ABCD General Hospital on 08/07/2003 secondary to ischemic ulcer on the right foot.

postop dysphagia.context: ENT was asked to see the patient regarding postop dysphagia with findings at that time of the consultation on 08/17/03 with a fiberoptic nasolaryngoscopy, a right parapharyngeal hemorrhagic lesion possibly secondary to LMA intubation.

right parapharyngeal hemorrhagic lesion.context: Preoperative Diagnoses: 2. Right parapharyngeal hemorrhagic lesion.

dysphagia with no signs of piriform sinu.context: Postoperative Diagnoses: 1. Dysphagia with no signs of piriform sinus pooling or aspiration.

no parapharyngeal hemorrhagic lesion not.context: Postoperative Diagnoses: 2. No parapharyngeal hemorrhagic lesion noted.

right parapharyngeal lesion, likely thyr.context: Postoperative Diagnoses: 3. Right parapharyngeal lesion, likely thyroid cartilage, nonhemorrhagic.

fiberoptic nasal laryngoscope.context: The patient was brought in the semi-Fowler's position, a fiberoptic nasal laryngoscope was then passed into the patient's right nasal passage, all the way to the nasopharynx.

nasopharynx.context: The scope was then flexed caudally and advanced slowly through the nasopharynx into the oropharynx, and down to the hypopharynx.

oropharynx.context: The scope was then flexed caudally and advanced slowly through the nasopharynx into the oropharynx, and down to the hypopharynx.

hypopharynx.context: The scope was then flexed caudally and advanced slowly through the nasopharynx into the oropharynx, and down to the hypopharynx.

area of fullness.context: Within the hypopharynx although there was an area of fullness and on the right side around the level of the thyroid cartilage cornu that seemed to be prominent and within the lumen of the hypopharynx.

prominent.context: Within the hypopharynx although there was an area of fullness and on the right side around the level of the thyroid cartilage cornu that seemed to be prominent and within the lumen of the hypopharynx.

epiglottis.context: The epiglottis, piriform sinuses, vallecula, and base of tongue all appeared normal with no signs of any gross lesions.

piriform sinuses.context: The epiglottis, piriform sinuses, vallecula, and base of tongue all appeared normal with no signs of any gross lesions.

vallecula.context: The epiglottis, piriform sinuses, vallecula, and base of tongue all appeared normal with no signs of any gross lesions.

base of tongue.context: The epiglottis, piriform sinuses, vallecula, and base of tongue all appeared normal with no signs of any gross lesions.

excellent phonation.context: The patient with excellent phonation with good glottic closure upon phonation and no signs of any aspiration or pooling of secretions.

good glottic closure.context: The patient with excellent phonation with good glottic closure upon phonation and no signs of any aspiration or pooling of secretions.

aspiration.context: The patient with excellent phonation with good glottic closure upon phonation and no signs of any aspiration or pooling of secretions.

pooling of secretions.context: The patient with excellent phonation with good glottic closure upon phonation and no signs of any aspiration or pooling of secretions.

outpatient.context: At this time, we will follow up as an outpatient and possibly there is a need for a microscopic suspension direct laryngoscopy for evaluation of this right parapharyngeal lesion.

microscopic suspension direct laryngosco.context: At this time, we will follow up as an outpatient and possibly there is a need for a microscopic suspension direct laryngoscopy for evaluation of this right parapharyngeal lesion.
